newsitem.title: INDIA: India's computer shares gain on budget sops.
newsitem.headline: India's computer shares gain on budget sops.

text.p: Shares of computer firms Infosys Technologies, NIIT and Tata Unisys surged on the Bombay bourse on Saturday, after the federal budget proposed a tax bonanza for the booming electronics industry.
Infosys shares jumped 75 rupees, or seven percent, to 1,125 rupees on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) in early trade.
NIIT shares were up 26 rupees, or 7.4 percent to 374 while shares of Tata Unisys climbed 49 rupees, or 13.6 percent, to 409 in early trade.
Finance Minister P. Chidambaram abolished import duties on computers and software and cut tariffs on electronic parts in the federal budget for 1997/98 (April-March) announced on Friday.
"The spread of information technology has radicaly altered conventional wisdom on growth strategies," Chidambaram told parliament as he presented radical tax cut proposals for the industry.
